2208        (?=\s*(?:\Z|\n{4,}|\n\1?\ {0,2}\S))  # until EOF, 3 blank lines or something less indented
2209        ''' % _admonitions,
2210        re.IGNORECASE | re.MULTILINE | re.VERBOSE
2211    )
2212
2213    def _do_admonitions_sub(self, match):
2214        lead_indent, admonition_name, title, body = match.groups()
2215
2216        admonition_type = '<strong>%s</strong>' % admonition_name
2217
2218        # figure out the class names to assign the block
2219        if admonition_name.lower() == 'admonition':
2220            admonition_class = 'admonition'
2221        else:
2222            admonition_class = 'admonition %s' % admonition_name.lower()
2223
2224        # titles are generally optional
2225        if title:
2226            title = '<em>%s</em>' % title
2227
2228        # process the admonition body like regular markdown
2229        body = self._run_block_gamut("\n%s\n" % self._uniform_outdent(body)[1])
2230
2231        # indent the body before placing inside the aside block
2232        admonition = self._uniform_indent('%s\n%s\n\n%s\n' % (admonition_type, title, body), self.tab, False)
2233        # wrap it in an aside
2234        admonition = '<aside class="%s">\n%s</aside>' % (admonition_class, admonition)
2235        # now indent the whole admonition back to where it started
2236        return self._uniform_indent(admonition, lead_indent, False)
2237
2238    def _do_admonitions(self, text):
2239        return self._admonitions_re.sub(self._do_admonitions_sub, text)
2240
2241    _strike_re = re.compile(r"~~(?=\S)(.+?)(?<=\S)~~", re.S)
2242    def _do_strike(self, text):
2243        text = self._strike_re.sub(r"<s>\1</s>", text)
2244        return text
2245
2246    _underline_re = re.compile(r"(?<!<!)--(?!>)(?=\S)(.+?)(?<=\S)(?<!<!)--(?!>)", re.S)
2247    def _do_underline(self, text):
2248        text = self._underline_re.sub(r"<u>\1</u>", text)
2249        return text
2250
2251    _tg_spoiler_re = re.compile(r"\|\|\s?(.+?)\s?\|\|", re.S)
2252    def _do_tg_spoiler(self, text):
2253        text = self._tg_spoiler_re.sub(r"<tg-spoiler>\1</tg-spoiler>", text)
2254        return text
2255
2256    _strong_re = re.compile(r"(\*\*|__)(?=\S)(.+?[*_]*)(?<=\S)\1", re.S)
2257    _em_re = re.compile(r"(\*|_)(?=\S)(.+?)(?<=\S)\1", re.S)
2258    _code_friendly_strong_re = re.compile(r"\*\*(?=\S)(.+?[*_]*)(?<=\S)\*\*", re.S)
2259    _code_friendly_em_re = re.compile(r"\*(?=\S)(.+?)(?<=\S)\*", re.S)
2260    def _do_italics_and_bold(self, text):
2261        # <strong> must go first:
2262        if "code-friendly" in self.extras:
2263            text = self._code_friendly_strong_re.sub(r"<strong>\1</strong>", text)
2264            text = self._code_friendly_em_re.sub(r"<em>\1</em>", text)
2265        else:
2266            text = self._strong_re.sub(r"<strong>\2</strong>", text)
2267            text = self._em_re.sub(r"<em>\2</em>", text)
2268        return text
2269
2270    # "smarty-pants" extra: Very liberal in interpreting a single prime as an
2271    # apostrophe; e.g. ignores the fact that "round", "bout", "twer", and
2272    # "twixt" can be written without an initial apostrophe. This is fine because
2273    # using scare quotes (single quotation marks) is rare.
2274    _apostrophe_year_re = re.compile(r"'(\d\d)(?=(\s|,|;|\.|\?|!|$))")
2275    _contractions = ["tis", "twas", "twer", "neath", "o", "n",
2276        "round", "bout", "twixt", "nuff", "fraid", "sup"]
2277    def _do_smart_contractions(self, text):
2278        text = self._apostrophe_year_re.sub(r"&#8217;\1", text)
2279        for c in self._contractions:
2280            text = text.replace("'%s" % c, "&#8217;%s" % c)
2281            text = text.replace("'%s" % c.capitalize(),
2282                "&#8217;%s" % c.capitalize())
2283        return text
2284
2285    # Substitute double-quotes before single-quotes.
2286    _opening_single_quote_re = re.compile(r"(?<!\S)'(?=\S)")
2287    _opening_double_quote_re = re.compile(r'(?<!\S)"(?=\S)')
2288    _closing_single_quote_re = re.compile(r"(?<=\S)'")
2289    _closing_double_quote_re = re.compile(r'(?<=\S)"(?=(\s|,|;|\.|\?|!|$))')
2290    def _do_smart_punctuation(self, text):
2291        """Fancifies 'single quotes', "double quotes", and apostrophes.
2292        Converts --, ---, and ... into en dashes, em dashes, and ellipses.
2293
2294        Inspiration is: <http://daringfireball.net/projects/smartypants/>
2295        See "test/tm-cases/smarty_pants.text" for a full discussion of the
2296        support here and
2297        <http://code.google.com/p/python-markdown2/issues/detail?id=42> for a
2298        discussion of some diversion from the original SmartyPants.
2299        """
2300        if "'" in text:  # guard for perf
2301            text = self._do_smart_contractions(text)
2302            text = self._opening_single_quote_re.sub("&#8216;", text)
2303            text = self._closing_single_quote_re.sub("&#8217;", text)
2304
2305        if '"' in text:  # guard for perf
2306            text = self._opening_double_quote_re.sub("&#8220;", text)
2307            text = self._closing_double_quote_re.sub("&#8221;", text)
2308
2309        text = text.replace("---", "&#8212;")
2310        text = text.replace("--", "&#8211;")
2311        text = text.replace("...", "&#8230;")
2312        text = text.replace(" . . . ", "&#8230;")
2313        text = text.replace(". . .", "&#8230;")
2314
2315        # TODO: Temporary hack to fix https://github.com/trentm/python-markdown2/issues/150
2316        if "footnotes" in self.extras and "footnote-ref" in text:
2317            # Quotes in the footnote back ref get converted to "smart" quotes
2318            # Change them back here to ensure they work.
2319            text = text.replace('class="footnote-ref&#8221;', 'class="footnote-ref"')
2320
2321        return text
2322
2323    _block_quote_base = r'''
2324        (                           # Wrap whole match in \1
2325          (
2326            ^[ \t]*>%s[ \t]?        # '>' at the start of a line
2327              .+\n                  # rest of the first line
2328            (.+\n)*                 # subsequent consecutive lines
2329          )+
2330        )
2331    '''
2332    _block_quote_re = re.compile(_block_quote_base % '', re.M | re.X)
2333    _block_quote_re_spoiler = re.compile(_block_quote_base % '[ \t]*?!?', re.M | re.X)
2334    _bq_one_level_re = re.compile('^[ \t]*>[ \t]?', re.M)
2335    _bq_one_level_re_spoiler = re.compile('^[ \t]*>[ \t]*?![ \t]?', re.M)
2336    _bq_all_lines_spoilers = re.compile(r'\A(?:^[ \t]*>[ \t]*?!.*[\n\r]*)+\Z', re.M)
2337    _html_pre_block_re = re.compile(r'(\s*<pre>.+?</pre>)', re.S)
2338    def _dedent_two_spaces_sub(self, match):
2339        return re.sub(r'(?m)^  ', '', match.group(1))
2340
2341    def _block_quote_sub(self, match):
2342        bq = match.group(1)
2343        is_spoiler = 'spoiler' in self.extras and self._bq_all_lines_spoilers.match(bq)
2344        # trim one level of quoting
2345        if is_spoiler:
2346            bq = self._bq_one_level_re_spoiler.sub('', bq)
2347        else:
2348            bq = self._bq_one_level_re.sub('', bq)
2349        # trim whitespace-only lines
2350        bq = self._ws_only_line_re.sub('', bq)
2351        bq = self._run_block_gamut(bq)          # recurse
2352
2353        bq = re.sub('(?m)^', '  ', bq)
2354        # These leading spaces screw with <pre> content, so we need to fix that:
2355        bq = self._html_pre_block_re.sub(self._dedent_two_spaces_sub, bq)
2356
2357        if is_spoiler:
2358            return '<blockquote class="spoiler">\n%s\n</blockquote>\n\n' % bq
2359        else:
2360            return '<blockquote>\n%s\n</blockquote>\n\n' % bq
2361
2362    def _do_block_quotes(self, text):
2363        if '>' not in text:
2364            return text
2365        if 'spoiler' in self.extras:
2366            return self._block_quote_re_spoiler.sub(self._block_quote_sub, text)
2367        else:
2368            return self._block_quote_re.sub(self._block_quote_sub, text)
2369
2370    def _form_paragraphs(self, text):
2371        # Strip leading and trailing lines:
2372        text = text.strip('\n')
2373
2374        # Wrap <p> tags.
2375        grafs = []
2376        for i, graf in enumerate(re.split(r"\n{2,}", text)):
2377            if graf in self.html_blocks:
2378                # Unhashify HTML blocks
2379                grafs.append(self.html_blocks[graf])
2380            else:
2381                cuddled_list = None
2382                if "cuddled-lists" in self.extras:
2383                    # Need to put back trailing '\n' for `_list_item_re`
2384                    # match at the end of the paragraph.
2385                    li = self._list_item_re.search(graf + '\n')
2386                    # Two of the same list marker in this paragraph: a likely
2387                    # candidate for a list cuddled to preceding paragraph
2388                    # text (issue 33). Note the `[-1]` is a quick way to
2389                    # consider numeric bullets (e.g. "1." and "2.") to be
2390                    # equal.
2391                    if (li and len(li.group(2)) <= 3
2392                            and (
2393                                    (li.group("next_marker") and li.group("marker")[-1] == li.group("next_marker")[-1])
2394                                    or
2395                                    li.group("next_marker") is None
2396                            )
2397                    ):
2398                        start = li.start()
2399                        cuddled_list = self._do_lists(graf[start:]).rstrip("\n")
2400                        assert re.match(r'^<(?:ul|ol).*?>', cuddled_list)
2401                        graf = graf[:start]
2402
2403                # Wrap <p> tags.
2404                graf = self._run_span_gamut(graf)
2405                grafs.append("<p%s>" % self._html_class_str_from_tag('p') + graf.lstrip(" \t") + "</p>")
2406
2407                if cuddled_list:
2408                    grafs.append(cuddled_list)
2409
2410        return "\n\n".join(grafs)
2411
2412    def _add_footnotes(self, text):
2413        if self.footnotes:
2414            footer = [
2415                '<div class="footnotes">',
2416                '<hr' + self.empty_element_suffix,
2417                '<ol>',
2418            ]
2419
2420            if not self.footnote_title:
2421                self.footnote_title = "Jump back to footnote %d in the text."
2422            if not self.footnote_return_symbol:
2423                self.footnote_return_symbol = "&#8617;"
2424
2425            for i, id in enumerate(self.footnote_ids):
2426                if i != 0:
2427                    footer.append('')
2428                footer.append('<li id="fn-%s">' % id)
2429                footer.append(self._run_block_gamut(self.footnotes[id]))
2430                try:
2431                    backlink = ('<a href="#fnref-%s" ' +
2432                            'class="footnoteBackLink" ' +
2433                            'title="' + self.footnote_title + '">' +
2434                            self.footnote_return_symbol +
2435                            '</a>') % (id, i+1)
2436                except TypeError:
2437                    log.debug("Footnote error. `footnote_title` "
2438                              "must include parameter. Using defaults.")
2439                    backlink = ('<a href="#fnref-%s" '
2440                        'class="footnoteBackLink" '
2441                        'title="Jump back to footnote %d in the text.">'
2442                        '&#8617;</a>' % (id, i+1))
2443
2444                if footer[-1].endswith("</p>"):
2445                    footer[-1] = footer[-1][:-len("</p>")] \
2446                        + '&#160;' + backlink + "</p>"
2447                else:
2448                    footer.append("\n<p>%s</p>" % backlink)
2449                footer.append('</li>')
2450            footer.append('</ol>')
2451            footer.append('</div>')
2452            return text + '\n\n' + '\n'.join(footer)
2453        else:
2454            return text
2455
2456    _naked_lt_re = re.compile(r'<(?![a-z/?\$!])', re.I)
2457    _naked_gt_re = re.compile(r'''(?<![a-z0-9?!/'"-])>''', re.I)
2458
2459    def _encode_amps_and_angles(self, text):
2460        # Smart processing for ampersands and angle brackets that need
2461        # to be encoded.
2462        text = _AMPERSAND_RE.sub('&amp;', text)
2463
2464        # Encode naked <'s
2465        text = self._naked_lt_re.sub('&lt;', text)
2466
2467        # Encode naked >'s
2468        # Note: Other markdown implementations (e.g. Markdown.pl, PHP
2469        # Markdown) don't do this.
2470        text = self._naked_gt_re.sub('&gt;', text)
2471        return text
2472
2473    _incomplete_tags_re = re.compile(r"<(/?\w+?(?!\w)\s*?.+?[\s/]+?)")
2474
2475    def _encode_incomplete_tags(self, text):
2476        if self.safe_mode not in ("replace", "escape"):
2477            return text
2478
2479        if text.endswith(">"):
2480            return text  # this is not an incomplete tag, this is a link in the form <http://x.y.z>
2481
2482        def incomplete_tags_sub(match):
2483            return match.group().replace('<', '&lt;')
2484
2485        return self._incomplete_tags_re.sub(incomplete_tags_sub, text)
2486
2487    def _encode_backslash_escapes(self, text):
2488        for ch, escape in list(self._escape_table.items()):
2489            text = text.replace("\\"+ch, escape)
2490        return text
2491
2492    _auto_link_re = re.compile(r'<((https?|ftp):[^\'">\s]+)>', re.I)
2493    def _auto_link_sub(self, match):
2494        g1 = match.group(1)
2495        return '<a href="%s">%s</a>' % (self._protect_url(g1), g1)
2496
2497    _auto_email_link_re = re.compile(r"""
2498          <
2499           (?:mailto:)?
2500          (
2501              [-.\w]+
2502              \@
2503              [-\w]+(\.[-\w]+)*\.[a-z]+
2504          )
2505          >
2506        """, re.I | re.X | re.U)
2507    def _auto_email_link_sub(self, match):
2508        return self._encode_email_address(
2509            self._unescape_special_chars(match.group(1)))
2510
2511    def _do_auto_links(self, text):
2512        text = self._auto_link_re.sub(self._auto_link_sub, text)
2513        text = self._auto_email_link_re.sub(self._auto_email_link_sub, text)
2514        return text
2515
2516    def _encode_email_address(self, addr):
2517        #  Input: an email address, e.g. "foo@example.com"
2518        #
2519        #  Output: the email address as a mailto link, with each character
2520        #      of the address encoded as either a decimal or hex entity, in
2521        #      the hopes of foiling most address harvesting spam bots. E.g.:
2522        #
2523        #    <a href="&#x6D;&#97;&#105;&#108;&#x74;&#111;:&#102;&#111;&#111;&#64;&#101;
2524        #       x&#x61;&#109;&#x70;&#108;&#x65;&#x2E;&#99;&#111;&#109;">&#102;&#111;&#111;
2525        #       &#64;&#101;x&#x61;&#109;&#x70;&#108;&#x65;&#x2E;&#99;&#111;&#109;</a>
2526        #
2527        #  Based on a filter by Matthew Wickline, posted to the BBEdit-Talk
2528        #  mailing list: <http://tinyurl.com/yu7ue>
2529        chars = [_xml_encode_email_char_at_random(ch)
2530                 for ch in "mailto:" + addr]
2531        # Strip the mailto: from the visible part.
2532        addr = '<a href="%s">%s</a>' \
2533               % (''.join(chars), ''.join(chars[7:]))
2534        return addr
2535
2536    _basic_link_re = re.compile(r'!?\[.*?\]\(.*?\)')
2537    def _do_link_patterns(self, text):
2538        link_from_hash = {}
2539        for regex, repl in self.link_patterns:
2540            replacements = []
2541            for match in regex.finditer(text):
2542                if any(self._match_overlaps_substr(text, match, h) for h in link_from_hash):
2543                    continue
2544
2545                if hasattr(repl, "__call__"):
2546                    href = repl(match)
2547                else:
2548                    href = match.expand(repl)
2549                replacements.append((match.span(), href))
2550            for (start, end), href in reversed(replacements):
2551
2552                # Do not match against links inside brackets.
2553                if text[start - 1:start] == '[' and text[end:end + 1] == ']':
2554                    continue
2555
2556                # Do not match against links in the standard markdown syntax.
2557                if text[start - 2:start] == '](' or text[end:end + 2] == '")':
2558                    continue
2559
2560                # Do not match against links which are escaped.
2561                if text[start - 3:start] == '"""' and text[end:end + 3] == '"""':
2562                    text = text[:start - 3] + text[start:end] + text[end + 3:]
2563                    continue
2564
2565                # search the text for anything that looks like a link
2566                is_inside_link = False
2567                for link_re in (self._auto_link_re, self._basic_link_re):
2568                    for match in link_re.finditer(text):
2569                        if any((r[0] <= start and end <= r[1]) for r in match.regs):
2570                            # if the link pattern start and end pos is within the bounds of
2571                            # something that looks like a link, then don't process it
2572                            is_inside_link = True
2573                            break
2574                    else:
2575                        continue
2576                    break
2577
2578                if is_inside_link:
2579                    continue
2580
2581                escaped_href = (
2582                    href.replace('"', '&quot;')  # b/c of attr quote
2583                        # To avoid markdown <em> and <strong>:
2584                        .replace('*', self._escape_table['*'])
2585                        .replace('_', self._escape_table['_']))
2586                link = '<a href="%s">%s</a>' % (escaped_href, text[start:end])
2587                hash = _hash_text(link)
2588                link_from_hash[hash] = link
2589                text = text[:start] + hash + text[end:]
2590        for hash, link in list(link_from_hash.items()):
2591            text = text.replace(hash, link)
2592        return text
2593
2594    def _unescape_special_chars(self, text):
2595        # Swap back in all the special characters we've hidden.
2596        while True:
2597            orig_text = text
2598            for ch, hash in list(self._escape_table.items()) + list(self._code_table.items()):
2599                text = text.replace(hash, ch)
2600            if text == orig_text:
2601                break
2602        return text
2603
2604    def _outdent(self, text):
2605        # Remove one level of line-leading tabs or spaces
2606        return self._outdent_re.sub('', text)
2607
2608    def _uniform_outdent(self, text, min_outdent=None, max_outdent=None):
2609        # Removes the smallest common leading indentation from each (non empty)
2610        # line of `text` and returns said indent along with the outdented text.
2611        # The `min_outdent` kwarg makes sure the smallest common whitespace
2612        # must be at least this size
2613        # The `max_outdent` sets the maximum amount a line can be
2614        # outdented by
2615
2616        # find the leading whitespace for every line
2617        whitespace = [
2618            re.findall(r'^[ \t]*', line)[0] if line else None
2619            for line in text.splitlines()
2620        ]
2621        whitespace_not_empty = [i for i in whitespace if i is not None]
2622
2623        # if no whitespace detected (ie: no lines in code block, issue #505)
2624        if not whitespace_not_empty:
2625            return '', text
2626
2627        # get minimum common whitespace
2628        outdent = min(whitespace_not_empty)
2629        # adjust min common ws to be within bounds
2630        if min_outdent is not None:
2631            outdent = min([i for i in whitespace_not_empty if i >= min_outdent] or [min_outdent])
2632        if max_outdent is not None:
2633            outdent = min(outdent, max_outdent)
2634
2635        outdented = []
2636        for line_ws, line in zip(whitespace, text.splitlines(True)):
2637            if line.startswith(outdent):
2638                # if line starts with smallest common ws, dedent it
2639                outdented.append(line.replace(outdent, '', 1))
2640            elif line_ws is not None and line_ws < outdent:
2641                # if less indented than min common whitespace then outdent as much as possible
2642                outdented.append(line.replace(line_ws, '', 1))
2643            else:
2644                outdented.append(line)
2645
2646        return outdent, ''.join(outdented)
2647
2648    def _uniform_indent(self, text, indent, include_empty_lines=False):
2649        return ''.join(
2650            (indent + line if line.strip() or include_empty_lines else '')
2651            for line in text.splitlines(True)
2652        )
2653
2654    @staticmethod
2655    def _match_overlaps_substr(text, match, substr):
2656        '''
2657        Checks if a regex match overlaps with a substring in the given text.
2658        '''
2659        for instance in re.finditer(re.escape(substr), text):
2660            start, end = instance.span()
2661            if start <= match.start() <= end:
2662                return True
2663            if start <= match.end() <= end:
2664                return True
2665        return False
Markdown( html4tags=False, tab_width=4, safe_mode=None, extras=None, link_patterns=None, footnote_title=None, footnote_return_symbol=None, use_file_vars=False, cli=False) 
203    def __init__(self, html4tags=False, tab_width=4, safe_mode=None,
204                 extras=None, link_patterns=None,
205                 footnote_title=None, footnote_return_symbol=None,
206                 use_file_vars=False, cli=False):
207        if html4tags:
208            self.empty_element_suffix = ">"
209        else:
210            self.empty_element_suffix = " />"
211        self.tab_width = tab_width
212        self.tab = tab_width * " "
213
214        # For compatibility with earlier markdown2.py and with
215        # markdown.py's safe_mode being a boolean,
216        #   safe_mode == True -> "replace"
217        if safe_mode is True:
218            self.safe_mode = "replace"
219        else:
220            self.safe_mode = safe_mode
221
222        # Massaging and building the "extras" info.
223        if self.extras is None:
224            self.extras = {}
225        elif not isinstance(self.extras, dict):
226            self.extras = dict([(e, None) for e in self.extras])
227        if extras:
228            if not isinstance(extras, dict):
229                extras = dict([(e, None) for e in extras])
230            self.extras.update(extras)
231        assert isinstance(self.extras, dict)
232
233        if "toc" in self.extras:
234            if "header-ids" not in self.extras:
235                self.extras["header-ids"] = None   # "toc" implies "header-ids"
236
237            if self.extras["toc"] is None:
238                self._toc_depth = 6
239            else:
240                self._toc_depth = self.extras["toc"].get("depth", 6)
241        self._instance_extras = self.extras.copy()
242
243        if 'link-patterns' in self.extras:
244            if link_patterns is None:
245                # if you have specified that the link-patterns extra SHOULD
246                # be used (via self.extras) but you haven't provided anything
247                # via the link_patterns argument then an error is raised
248                raise MarkdownError("If the 'link-patterns' extra is used, an argument for 'link_patterns' is required")
249        self.link_patterns = link_patterns
250        self.footnote_title = footnote_title
251        self.footnote_return_symbol = footnote_return_symbol
252        self.use_file_vars = use_file_vars
253        self._outdent_re = re.compile(r'^(\t|[ ]{1,%d})' % tab_width, re.M)
254        self.cli = cli
255
256        self._escape_table = g_escape_table.copy()
257        self._code_table = {}
258        if "smarty-pants" in self.extras:
259            self._escape_table['"'] = _hash_text('"')
260            self._escape_table["'"] = _hash_text("'")
extras = None
urls = None
titles = None
html_blocks = None
html_spans = None
html_removed_text = '{(#HTML#)}'
html_removed_text_compat = '[HTML_REMOVED]'
list_level = 0
tab_width
tab
link_patterns
footnote_title
footnote_return_symbol
use_file_vars
cli
def reset(self): 
262    def reset(self):
263        self.urls = {}
264        self.titles = {}
265        self.html_blocks = {}
266        self.html_spans = {}
267        self.list_level = 0
268        self.extras = self._instance_extras.copy()
269        self._setup_extras()
270        self._toc = None
def convert(self, text): 
299    def convert(self, text):
300        """Convert the given text."""
301        # Main function. The order in which other subs are called here is
302        # essential. Link and image substitutions need to happen before
303        # _EscapeSpecialChars(), so that any *'s or _'s in the <a>
304        # and <img> tags get encoded.
305
306        # Clear the global hashes. If we don't clear these, you get conflicts
307        # from other articles when generating a page which contains more than
308        # one article (e.g. an index page that shows the N most recent
309        # articles):
310        self.reset()
311
312        if not isinstance(text, str):
313            # TODO: perhaps shouldn't presume UTF-8 for string input?
314            text = str(text, 'utf-8')
315
316        if self.use_file_vars:
317            # Look for emacs-style file variable hints.
318            text = self._emacs_oneliner_vars_pat.sub(self._emacs_vars_oneliner_sub, text)
319            emacs_vars = self._get_emacs_vars(text)
320            if "markdown-extras" in emacs_vars:
321                splitter = re.compile("[ ,]+")
322                for e in splitter.split(emacs_vars["markdown-extras"]):
323                    if '=' in e:
324                        ename, earg = e.split('=', 1)
325                        try:
326                            earg = int(earg)
327                        except ValueError:
328                            pass
329                    else:
330                        ename, earg = e, None
331                    self.extras[ename] = earg
332
333            self._setup_extras()
334
335        # Standardize line endings:
336        text = text.replace("\r\n", "\n")
337        text = text.replace("\r", "\n")
338
339        # Make sure $text ends with a couple of newlines:
340        text += "\n\n"
341
342        # Convert all tabs to spaces.
343        text = self._detab(text)
344
345        # Strip any lines consisting only of spaces and tabs.
346        # This makes subsequent regexen easier to write, because we can
347        # match consecutive blank lines with /\n+/ instead of something
348        # contorted like /[ \t]*\n+/ .
349        text = self._ws_only_line_re.sub("", text)
350
351        # strip metadata from head and extract
352        if "metadata" in self.extras:
353            text = self._extract_metadata(text)
354
355        text = self.preprocess(text)
356
357        if 'wavedrom' in self.extras:
358            text = self._do_wavedrom_blocks(text)
359
360        if "fenced-code-blocks" in self.extras and not self.safe_mode:
361            text = self._do_fenced_code_blocks(text)
362
363        if self.safe_mode:
364            text = self._hash_html_spans(text)
365
366        # Turn block-level HTML blocks into hash entries
367        text = self._hash_html_blocks(text, raw=True)
368
369        if "fenced-code-blocks" in self.extras and self.safe_mode:
370            text = self._do_fenced_code_blocks(text)
371
372        if 'admonitions' in self.extras:
373            text = self._do_admonitions(text)
374
375        # Because numbering references aren't links (yet?) then we can do everything associated with counters
376        # before we get started
377        if "numbering" in self.extras:
378            text = self._do_numbering(text)
379
380        # Strip link definitions, store in hashes.
381        if "footnotes" in self.extras:
382            # Must do footnotes first because an unlucky footnote defn
383            # looks like a link defn:
384            #   [^4]: this "looks like a link defn"
385            text = self._strip_footnote_definitions(text)
386        text = self._strip_link_definitions(text)
387
388        text = self._run_block_gamut(text)
389
390        if "footnotes" in self.extras:
391            text = self._add_footnotes(text)
392
393        text = self.postprocess(text)
394
395        text = self._unescape_special_chars(text)
396
397        if self.safe_mode:
398            text = self._unhash_html_spans(text)
399            # return the removed text warning to its markdown.py compatible form
400            text = text.replace(self.html_removed_text, self.html_removed_text_compat)
401
402        do_target_blank_links = "target-blank-links" in self.extras
403        do_nofollow_links = "nofollow" in self.extras
404
405        if do_target_blank_links and do_nofollow_links:
406            text = self._a_nofollow_or_blank_links.sub(r'<\1 rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank"\2', text)
407        elif do_target_blank_links:
408            text = self._a_nofollow_or_blank_links.sub(r'<\1 rel="noopener" target="_blank"\2', text)
409        elif do_nofollow_links:
410            text = self._a_nofollow_or_blank_links.sub(r'<\1 rel="nofollow"\2', text)
411
412        if "toc" in self.extras and self._toc:
413            self._toc_html = calculate_toc_html(self._toc)
414
415            # Prepend toc html to output
416            if self.cli:
417                text = '{}\n{}'.format(self._toc_html, text)
418
419        text += "\n"
420
421        # Attach attrs to output
422        rv = UnicodeWithAttrs(text)
423
424        if "toc" in self.extras and self._toc:
425            rv.toc_html = self._toc_html
426
427        if "metadata" in self.extras:
428            rv.metadata = self.metadata
429        return rv

Convert the given text.

def postprocess(self, text): 
431    def postprocess(self, text):
432        """A hook for subclasses to do some postprocessing of the html, if
433        desired. This is called before unescaping of special chars and
434        unhashing of raw HTML spans.
435        """
436        return text

A hook for subclasses to do some postprocessing of the html, if desired. This is called before unescaping of special chars and unhashing of raw HTML spans.

def preprocess(self, text): 
438    def preprocess(self, text):
439        """A hook for subclasses to do some preprocessing of the Markdown, if
440        desired. This is called after basic formatting of the text, but prior
441        to any extras, safe mode, etc. processing.
442        """
443        return text

A hook for subclasses to do some preprocessing of the Markdown, if desired. This is called after basic formatting of the text, but prior to any extras, safe mode, etc. processing.

def header_id_from_text(self, text, prefix, n): 
1684    def header_id_from_text(self, text, prefix, n):
1685        """Generate a header id attribute value from the given header
1686        HTML content.
1687
1688        This is only called if the "header-ids" extra is enabled.
1689        Subclasses may override this for different header ids.
1690
1691        @param text {str} The text of the header tag
1692        @param prefix {str} The requested prefix for header ids. This is the
1693            value of the "header-ids" extra key, if any. Otherwise, None.
1694        @param n {int} The <hN> tag number, i.e. `1` for an <h1> tag.
1695        @returns {str} The value for the header tag's "id" attribute. Return
1696            None to not have an id attribute and to exclude this header from
1697            the TOC (if the "toc" extra is specified).
1698        """
1699        header_id = _slugify(text)
1700        if prefix and isinstance(prefix, str):
1701            header_id = prefix + '-' + header_id
1702
1703        self._count_from_header_id[header_id] += 1
1704        if 0 == len(header_id) or self._count_from_header_id[header_id] > 1:
1705            header_id += '-%s' % self._count_from_header_id[header_id]
1706
1707        return header_id

Generate a header id attribute value from the given header HTML content.

This is only called if the "header-ids" extra is enabled. Subclasses may override this for different header ids.

@param text {str} The text of the header tag @param prefix {str} The requested prefix for header ids. This is the value of the "header-ids" extra key, if any. Otherwise, None. @param n {int} The tag number, i.e. 1 for an

tag. @returns {str} The value for the header tag's "id" attribute. Return None to not have an id attribute and to exclude this header from the TOC (if the "toc" extra is specified).

class MarkdownWithExtras(Markdown): 
2668class MarkdownWithExtras(Markdown):
2669    """A markdowner class that enables most extras:
2670
2671    - footnotes
2672    - fenced-code-blocks (only highlights code if 'pygments' Python module on path)
2673
2674    These are not included:
2675    - pyshell (specific to Python-related documenting)
2676    - code-friendly (because it *disables* part of the syntax)
2677    - link-patterns (because you need to specify some actual
2678      link-patterns anyway)
2679    """
2680    extras = ["footnotes", "fenced-code-blocks"]

A markdowner class that enables most extras:

  • footnotes
  • fenced-code-blocks (only highlights code if 'pygments' Python module on path)

These are not included:

  • pyshell (specific to Python-related documenting)
  • code-friendly (because it disables part of the syntax)
  • link-patterns (because you need to specify some actual link-patterns anyway)
extras = ['footnotes', 'fenced-code-blocks']
Inherited Members

def calculate_toc_html(toc): 
2686def calculate_toc_html(toc):
2687    """Return the HTML for the current TOC.
2688
2689    This expects the `_toc` attribute to have been set on this instance.
2690    """
2691    if toc is None:
2692        return None
2693
2694    def indent():
2695        return '  ' * (len(h_stack) - 1)
2696    lines = []
2697    h_stack = [0]   # stack of header-level numbers
2698    for level, id, name in toc:
2699        if level > h_stack[-1]:
2700            lines.append("%s<ul>" % indent())
2701            h_stack.append(level)
2702        elif level == h_stack[-1]:
2703            lines[-1] += "</li>"
2704        else:
2705            while level < h_stack[-1]:
2706                h_stack.pop()
2707                if not lines[-1].endswith("</li>"):
2708                    lines[-1] += "</li>"
2709                lines.append("%s</ul></li>" % indent())
2710        lines.append('%s<li><a href="#%s">%s</a>' % (
2711            indent(), id, name))
2712    while len(h_stack) > 1:
2713        h_stack.pop()
2714        if not lines[-1].endswith("</li>"):
2715            lines[-1] += "</li>"
2716        lines.append("%s</ul>" % indent())
2717    return '\n'.join(lines) + '\n'

Return the HTML for the current TOC.

This expects the _toc attribute to have been set on this instance.

class UnicodeWithAttrs(builtins.str): 
2720class UnicodeWithAttrs(str):
2721    """A subclass of unicode used for the return value of conversion to
2722    possibly attach some attributes. E.g. the "toc_html" attribute when
2723    the "toc" extra is used.
2724    """
2725    metadata = None
2726    toc_html = None

A subclass of unicode used for the return value of conversion to possibly attach some attributes. E.g. the "toc_html" attribute when the "toc" extra is used.

metadata = None
toc_html = None

def main(argv=None): 
2997def main(argv=None):
2998    if argv is None:
2999        argv = sys.argv
3000    if not logging.root.handlers:
3001        logging.basicConfig()
3002
3003    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(
3004        prog="markdown2", description=cmdln_desc, usage='%(prog)s [PATHS...]',
3005        formatter_class=_NoReflowFormatter
3006    )
3007    parser.add_argument('--version', action='version',
3008                        version='%(prog)s {version}'.format(version=__version__))
3009    parser.add_argument('paths', nargs='*',
3010                        help=(
3011                            'optional list of files to convert.'
3012                            'If none are given, stdin will be used'
3013                        ))
3014    parser.add_argument("-v", "--verbose", dest="log_level",
3015                      action="store_const", const=logging.DEBUG,
3016                      help="more verbose output")
3017    parser.add_argument("--encoding",
3018                      help="specify encoding of text content")
3019    parser.add_argument("--html4tags", action="store_true", default=False,
3020                      help="use HTML 4 style for empty element tags")
3021    parser.add_argument("-s", "--safe", metavar="MODE", dest="safe_mode",
3022                      help="sanitize literal HTML: 'escape' escapes "
3023                           "HTML meta chars, 'replace' replaces with an "
3024                           "[HTML_REMOVED] note")
3025    parser.add_argument("-x", "--extras", action="append",
3026                      help="Turn on specific extra features (not part of "
3027                           "the core Markdown spec). See above.")
3028    parser.add_argument("--use-file-vars",
3029                      help="Look for and use Emacs-style 'markdown-extras' "
3030                           "file var to turn on extras. See "
3031                           "<https://github.com/trentm/python-markdown2/wiki/Extras>")
3032    parser.add_argument("--link-patterns-file",
3033                      help="path to a link pattern file")
3034    parser.add_argument("--self-test", action="store_true",
3035                      help="run internal self-tests (some doctests)")
3036    parser.add_argument("--compare", action="store_true",
3037                      help="run against Markdown.pl as well (for testing)")
3038    parser.set_defaults(log_level=logging.INFO, compare=False,
3039                        encoding="utf-8", safe_mode=None, use_file_vars=False)
3040    opts = parser.parse_args()
3041    paths = opts.paths
3042    log.setLevel(opts.log_level)
3043
3044    if opts.self_test:
3045        return _test()
3046
3047    if opts.extras:
3048        extras = {}
3049        for s in opts.extras:
3050            splitter = re.compile("[,;: ]+")
3051            for e in splitter.split(s):
3052                if '=' in e:
3053                    ename, earg = e.split('=', 1)
3054                    try:
3055                        earg = int(earg)
3056                    except ValueError:
3057                        pass
3058                else:
3059                    ename, earg = e, None
3060                extras[ename] = earg
3061    else:
3062        extras = None
3063
3064    if opts.link_patterns_file:
3065        link_patterns = []
3066        f = open(opts.link_patterns_file)
3067        try:
3068            for i, line in enumerate(f.readlines()):
3069                if not line.strip(): continue
3070                if line.lstrip().startswith("#"): continue
3071                try:
3072                    pat, href = line.rstrip().rsplit(None, 1)
3073                except ValueError:
3074                    raise MarkdownError("%s:%d: invalid link pattern line: %r"
3075                                        % (opts.link_patterns_file, i+1, line))
3076                link_patterns.append(
3077                    (_regex_from_encoded_pattern(pat), href))
3078        finally:
3079            f.close()
3080    else:
3081        link_patterns = None
3082
3083    from os.path import abspath, dirname, exists, join
3084    markdown_pl = join(dirname(dirname(abspath(__file__))), "test",
3085                       "Markdown.pl")
3086    if not paths:
3087        paths = ['-']
3088    for path in paths:
3089        if path == '-':
3090            text = sys.stdin.read()
3091        else:
3092            fp = codecs.open(path, 'r', opts.encoding)
3093            text = fp.read()
3094            fp.close()
3095        if opts.compare:
3096            from subprocess import PIPE, Popen
3097            print("==== Markdown.pl ====")
3098            p = Popen('perl %s' % markdown_pl, shell=True, stdin=PIPE, stdout=PIPE, close_fds=True)
3099            p.stdin.write(text.encode('utf-8'))
3100            p.stdin.close()
3101            perl_html = p.stdout.read().decode('utf-8')
3102            sys.stdout.write(perl_html)
3103            print("==== markdown2.py ====")
3104        html = markdown(text,
3105            html4tags=opts.html4tags,
3106            safe_mode=opts.safe_mode,
3107            extras=extras, link_patterns=link_patterns,
3108            use_file_vars=opts.use_file_vars,
3109            cli=True)
3110        sys.stdout.write(html)
3111        if extras and "toc" in extras:
3112            log.debug("toc_html: " +
3113                str(html.toc_html.encode(sys.stdout.encoding or "utf-8", 'xmlcharrefreplace')))
3114        if opts.compare:
3115            test_dir = join(dirname(dirname(abspath(__file__))), "test")
3116            if exists(join(test_dir, "test_markdown2.py")):
3117                sys.path.insert(0, test_dir)
3118                from test_markdown2 import norm_html_from_html
3119                norm_html = norm_html_from_html(html)
3120                norm_perl_html = norm_html_from_html(perl_html)
3121            else:
3122                norm_html = html
3123                norm_perl_html = perl_html
3124            print("==== match? %r ====" % (norm_perl_html == norm_html))
